text: once again questions are being asked
about one of Donald Trump's key
appointments once again it's all to do
with Russia the man at the center of the
Rao the new US Attorney General Jeff
Sessions it's claimed he had two
undisclosed conversations with the
Russian ambassador sergeich is lyac
during the Trump election campaign when
he was still a senator but it's a
conversation he didn't mention at his
confirmation hearing when asked whether
anyone affiliated with that election
campaign had contact with the Russians
now senior Democrats including House
Leader Nancy Pelosi say he should resign
accusing him of lying under oath in a
statement mr. sessions said I never met
with any Russian officials to discuss
issues of the campaign I have no idea
what this allegation is about it is
false it comes just weeks after former
national security adviser Michael Flynn
was forced to resign after he misled the
White House about conversations again
with the Russian ambassador to the US
allegedly regarding sanctions against
Moscow in a further twist US lawmakers
in the House of Representatives have
announced they will investigate possible
contacts between Moscow and president
Trump's campaign after claims the
Kremlin worked to help him defeat
Hillary Clinton we do need to have some
scrutiny put on to the to the Russian
government and we do need to know if
there are any Americans that are talking
to the Russians
and anybody connected to the Russian
government or Russian agents ever since
his election Donald Trump has repeatedly
denied close ties with Russia but this
development is likely to increase that
scrutiny even further
Greg Dawson BBC News
